oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of raccoon hunters, a costume party, children at a daycare, a baby playing, the Una Boys' Club, and flooded downtown Nashville. Nashville Banner, 1927 January 23.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: West, Louis; Cockrill, W. W.; Reynolds, Mrs. Park; Reynolds, Park; Allen, Gentry; Jones, W. P.; Seward, McCray; Toons, Earl; West, Thomas; Smiser; Frakes, Jo Anne; Tune, Ewing, Sr.; Frakes, F. F.
Nashville Banner; Nashville Railway and Light Company--History--Sources
Raccoon hunting; Costumes; Children; Infants; Boys; Floods
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of Williamson County raccoon hunters, a "tacky" party of female employees of Nashville Railway and Light Company dressed in costumes, children at Russell Street Church of Christ daycare at 607 South Fifth Street, a baby playing with her father in Columbia, the Una Boys' Club, and flooded downtown Nashville at First Avenue. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
